title: Pakistani students saved from dangling cable car
description: Seven students and one teacher in Pakistan were rescued from a cable car dangling over a ravine after an overhead line snapped. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez has details of the rescue as Pakistan’s prime minister confirms the children’s safety.

title: NYC Mayor Adams pledges ‘to stamp out antisemitism’ during trip to Israel
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams described his visit to the Yad Vashem Holocaust memorial as “a moment of commitment to not only saying never again, but living never again.”

title: All 8 people rescued from dangling Pakistan cable car
description: A group of seven children and one teacher trapped in a dangling cable car above a ravine in northern Pakistan have been rescued. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports how the military helicopter rescue mission was completed before nightfall.

title: 15 dead, 36 injured in Mexico bus crash, most apparently Venezuelan migrants
description: A bus carrying mostly Venezuelan migrants crashed into a freight truck Tuesday in central Mexico, killing at least 15 people and injuring 36, local authorities said.

title: Some children rescued from Pakistan cable car suspended above ravine
description: The helicopter mission to rescue four remaining children and two adults from a dangling cable car in northern Pakistan has been called off until the morning. The Pakistani military managed to rescue two of the children from the cable car before calling the mission off for the day.

title: Watch: Child rescued from dangling cable car in Pakistan
description: Video shows the moment a child is rescued from a dangling cable car in Battagram, Pakistan. A group of six children and two adults became stranded after one of the cable car’s ropes broke while crossing a deep ravine.

title: Schoolkids trapped in cable car above ravine in Pakistan after cable snaps
description: A cable car holding six children and two adults dangled hundreds of feet above a ravine in Pakistan for hours after one of the cables snapped.

title: Firefighters find the bodies of 18 people in an area of northeast Greece ravaged by wildfires
description: Greek firefighters found the bodies of 18 people in an area of northeastern Greece ravaged by a major wildfire burning for days, authorities said.

title: 18 people found dead in Greece as wildfires rage across Europe
description: Greek firefighters found the bodies of 18 people in an area ravaged by a major wildfire burning for days, authorities said Tuesday.

title: India blocks independent news outlet in Kashmir
description: An independent news outlet in Indian-administered Kashmir has been evicted from its office after access to its website and social media accounts was blocked.

title: Watch: Prigozhin's latest recruitment video for the Wagner mercenary group
description: Russian mercenary leader Yevgeny Prigozhin has published his first recruitment video for the Wagner Group since organizing a short-lived mutiny against Moscow.

title: Release of radioactive water from Fukushima to start on Aug. 24
description: Despite opposition at home and abroad, Japan will start releasing more than 1 million tons of treated radioactive water from the wrecked Fukushima nuclear power plant on Aug. 24, Prime Minister Fumio Kishida announced.

title: Children stranded 900 feet in the air after chair lift cable snaps in Pakistan
description: Eight people, including six school children, were trapped in a malfunctioning chair lift in northern Pakistan on Tuesday, officials said, and a military helicopter has been dispatched to rescue them.

title: Kim Jong Un blasts ‘irresponsible’ top officials for North Korea flood damage
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has lashed out at top officials for their “irresponsible” response to flood damage, saying they had “spoiled” the national economy, state media reported on Tuesday.

title: BRICS leaders meet in South Africa as the bloc weighs expansion
description: Leaders of the BRICS nations — Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa — are due to open a summit in Johannesburg on Tuesday where they will weigh expanding membership as some members push to forge the bloc into a counterweight to the West.

title: Thailand’s divisive former leader Thaksin Shinawatra returns after 15 years in exile
description: Former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra returned to Thailand from exile on Tuesday as a party affiliated with him planned to start forming a new government.

title: After being ruled by one man for 38 years, Cambodia has a new leader: His son
description: Hun Manet, the son of longtime autocratic Cambodian leader Hun Sen, was approved by Parliament on Tuesday as the country’s new prime minister.

title: Japan to release Fukushima water into the ocean starting Thursday
description: Japan said it will start releasing more than 1 million metric tons of treated radioactive water from the wrecked Fukushima nuclear power plant on Thursday.

title: Ecuador holds election with armed guards amid recent violence
description: Citizens in Ecuador are heading to the polls just over a week after a candidate was shot and killed. The critical election is happening as the country is facing an uptick in crime and gang violence.
